content.p: There is growing recognition that addressing environmental and sustainability challenges requires a unique combination of fundamental knowledge, practical problem-solving skills and interpersonal competencies. Our three master's courses give you skills that prepare you for the workplace. Our guide to applying Funding information Explore the intersection between present and future climate change, the environment and society, through several modules that span the social and physical sciences. On this course you will gain an understanding of fundamental environmental processes and the ways in which contemporary environmental decisions are made. On this course you will look at environmental, social, economic and political factors that shape sustainable development and translate theory into practical outcomes. Discover campus life with 360 degree images and videos on our virtual tour. Experience student life by exploring areas such as accommodation, student services, sport centres, libraries and the Researcher Academy. Visit our virtual tour We offer pre-sessional English language courses to improve your language level to meet the entry requirements for your degree. There is continued support while you study with us, with courses, consultations and drop-ins available. English language support Sir Clive Granger Building University of Nottingham University Park Nottingham, NG7 2RD
